articles.title: World Cup: Unbeaten South Africa face winless Netherlands
articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as unbeaten South Africa play the winless Netherlands in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.content:
In case you were wondering, it's South Africa who are the unbeaten side - triumphing over Sri Lanka, where they racked up a few tournament records, and Australia.
Meanwhile the Netherlands have been… [+160 chars]

articles.author: sport
articles.title: Proteas won't be 'arrogant' against Dutch at Cricket World Cup
articles.description: South Africa captain Temba Bavuma insists his team cannot afford to be "arrogant or loud" when they face the Netherlands in the Cricket World Cup on Tuesday, wary of the shock defeat they suffered against the Dutch at the World T20 last year.
articles.content:
• After a strong start to the Cricket World Cup where they've won their two opening games, South Africa will look for a third win when they face the Netherlands on Tuesday.

articles.title: The doctor who played at World Cups in two sports
articles.description: Meet Rudie van Vuuren, who in 2003 played in both the Rugby World Cup and Cricket World Cup.
articles.content:
Rudie van Vuuren is the only person to represent their country at two World Cups in different sports
"You know, sometimes rugby players on cricket fields are not good things."
